title: SB 1.19.5 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 05-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Loving devotional service to Krishna is the greatest achievement nothing else can compare with that
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verse 5 of the 19th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on Maharaj Pariksit's preparation for death through Krishna consciousness and renunciation of other self-realization practices.

segments.key_quote: For a devotee like Pariksit Maharaj none of the material planets even the topmost brahma loka is as desirable as Goloka Vrindavana
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's purport, contrasting the desires of a devotee (Goloka Vrindavana) with the limited understanding of material existence by modern scientists and philosophers, emphasizing the superiority of Krishna's abode.

segments.key_quote: Krishna's personal abode is called Goloka Vrindavana and that is the destination desired by pure devotees of Krishna like Parikshit Maharaj.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the vastness of the material creation, including innumerable universes and planets, and the insignificance of human beings within this scheme, while highlighting the importance of Goloka Vrindavana.

segments.key_quote: Due to false ego, due to ignorance, due to being under the influence of illusion we think oh human beings are the greatest in the entire creation, no there are higher beings
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the influence of false ego and illusion, emphasizing the importance of spiritual masters and reading the Bhagavad Gita as explained by a bona fide Acharya like Srila Prabhupada.

segments.key_quote: The devotee always desires to go back home, back to Godhead just to become one of the associates of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the fundamental misery of material existence is the repetition of birth and death, and the best place for residence is the spiritual world, desiring to be an associate of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: The planets in the spiritual sky, the Vaikuntha lokas and Goloka Vrindavana are eternally situated.
segments.summary: The speaker differentiates between Vaikuntha planets and Goloka Vrindavana in the spiritual sky, emphasizing their eternal nature compared to the temporary nature of material planets.

segments.key_quote: In the spiritual sky, there are so many spiritual planets, eternally situated, no creation in the spiritual planets, no misery, no birth, no disease, no old age, no suffering, only pure transcendental bliss
segments.summary: The speaker describes the location of the spiritual sky beyond the causal ocean, highlighting the absence of misery and the presence of transcendental bliss, emphasizing the confidential nature of this knowledge.

segments.key_quote: Only the Vaishnavas, the pure devas, are able to promote themselves to higher planets in this universe.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the Vaishnavas' knowledge of the spiritual and material planets with the limited understanding of modern scientists, emphasizing that even the heavenly planets are still places of death.

segments.key_quote: He became determined in the transcendental loving service of Lord Krishna by complete fasting in the bank of the transcendental river Yamuna.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by describing Maharaj Pariksit's determination in transcendental loving service through fasting on the banks of the river Yamuna, clarifying a potential discrepancy with earlier mentions of the Ganges.
